ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: The Digital Analyzer demo shows a multi-surface pane, interactive MVVM demo rendering FastLineRenderableSeries that uses UniformXyDataSeries as data source.
ExampleDefinition.Description:
A Digital Analyzer is an electronic instrument that captures and displays multiple signals from a digital system or digital circuit.
The Digital Analyzer demo shows multiple channels with randomly generated data with common XAxis. It is implemented using MVVM pattern to display multi-surface pane rendering FastLineRenderableSeries that use UniformXyDataSeries as data source. This DataSeries type requires Y-Values only, thuse reducing memory consumption. In this way it is possible to display tens of billions of points on a single view.
Interactivity is provided by ChartModifiers.
[b][i] The following interactions are possible:[/i][/b]
- [b][CTRL + MouseWheel][/b] to scroll channels up and down - [b][SHIFT + MouseWheel][/b] to change the hight of channels - [b][Mousewheel][/b] to zoom channels data in and out - Click and drag [b][Left Mouse Button][/b] to zoom in channels data - Double-click [b][Left Mouse Button][/b] to zoom to data extents
[b][i] Toolbar actions: [/i][/b]
- Toggle [b][Pan Button][/b] in the Toolbar to enable panning - Press [b][+][/b] to add a new channel - Hover over [b][CT][/b] to select type of channel to add from a Dropdown - Hover over [b][PC][/b] to choose amount of channels and points per channel - Press [b][LOAD][/b] to generate and load new channels list
